PageTitle: peer substitute-as (BGP-IPv4 unicast address family view)
FuncDef:
The peer substitute-as command substitutes the local AS number for the AS number of a specified peer in the AS_Path attribute in the advertisement direction.
The undo peer substitute-as command disables AS number substitution. The peer substitute-as command substitutes the local AS number for the AS number of a specified peer in the AS_Path attribute in the advertisement direction. The undo peer substitute-as command disables AS number substitution. By default, AS number substitution is disabled.
ParentView: BGP-IPv4 unicast address family view,BGP view

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies an IPv4 peer address.
The value is in dotted decimal notation.

ExtraInfo: In a BGP public network scenario, when two devices with the same AS number learn a BGP route from each other through the same EBGP peer, the route may be discarded because the AS_Path attribute contains duplicate AS numbers. To prevent this problem, run the peer substitute-as command on this EBGP peer to enable AS number substitution in the advertisement direction.
